metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39189 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel. Thenfnl_osf_add_callback function did not validate the user mode controlledopt_num field. This flaw allows a local privileged (CAP_NET_ADMIN) attackerto trigger an out-of-bounds read, leading to a crash or informationdisclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39189` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1163.176~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1126.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-220.231~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.176~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1126.137~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
